info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 22 at 1:26AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT FOR MERCER...SOUTHWESTERN VENANGO...NORTHERN LAWRENCE AND NORTHWESTERN BUTLER COUNTIES... At 126 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 9 miles north of Grove City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Hermitage, Grove City, Franklin, Greenville, Slippery Rock, New Wilmington, Mercer, Pulaski, Stoneboro, New Bedford, Harrisville, and West Middlesex. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
